result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard S. Heschke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard S. Heschke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard S. Heschke was found guilty of Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.314(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 34 days of jail maybe imposed if not paid by due date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard S. Heschke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice to DNR of court ordered revocation

records.addlTxt: 08:49 15CT167 and 15FO387 also heard at this time. Defendant Richard S. Heschke in court, pro se.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: 15FO387 state moves to dismiss by agreement, 15CM271 plead guilty to count 1 $1713.00 minimum restriction of revocation of hunting privelages 3 years, count 2 dismiss, 15CT167 dismiss count 1 and 2. Defendant agrees. Court goes over plea questionnaire and waiver of rights on the record with the defendant. Court reviews constitutional right to an attorney with the defendant on the record.  Court reviews constitutional right to waiver of an attorney on the record. Defendant wishes to go forward without an attorney and would like to represent himself. Defendant has made this choice of his own free will.  Court approves waiver of right to an attorney.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 in 15CM271. Court forms factual basis from criminal complaint.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 1 in 15CM271, count 2 is dismissed, all counts in 15CT167 dismissed and 15FO387 is also dismissed. Defendant addresses the court, Froelich will try to contact the DNR regarding bow that was confiscated. Court orders for 15CM271 count 1: $1713.00 (includes surcharges, penalties, assessments, etc.) 1 year to pay defendant is advised to pay monthly. 3 year revocation of hunting priviledges. Court reviews appeal rights with the defendant. 09:07
Status conference on June 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

10:36 Defendant Richard S. Heschke in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CT167 and 15FO387. Previously the Court addressed the courtroom re: rights as a  group.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Court notes Def came in  part way through the reading of the rights and goes over them again.  Def pleas not guilty to 15CM271, 15CT167 and 15FO387. Court rec/ enter. OSullivan: $1000 signature bond on 15CM271. $1000 signature bond on 15CT167.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
